Vanilla game
Block Sensor
Allows detection of the presence of a block at a selected adjacent position and, based on the input signal, detects how full its inventory slots are.
The input signal determines which slot should be scanned.
Signal 1–14 correspond to slots 0–13. The output is the fill level of the slot relative to the maximum stack size of the item in that slot, converted to a signal 0–15.
Signal 15 indicates that the sensor should detect the block state based on the block type.
Currently supported blocks are:
Chest or any general container – the output signal corresponds to the total fullness of the container.
Any blocks with inventory slots – the output signal corresponds to the fill level of those slots.
Anvil – the output signal corresponds to the number of work items present.

Electrical Progressive
EP Switch
Allows switching on or off the transmission of electric current.
If there is a signal at the input, the switch is ON. If there is no signal, the switch is OFF.
